Based on the search results, here's what I found about Claude Skills Agents API documentation for 2025:

## Overview

Agent Skills are modular capabilities that extend Claude's functionality, with each Skill packaging instructions, metadata, and optional resources (scripts, templates) that Claude uses automatically when relevant.

## Available Skills

Anthropic provides pre-built Skills for working with PowerPoint (.pptx), Excel (.xlsx), Word (.docx), and PDF files, and you can upload your own Skills via the Skills API (/v1/skills endpoints) to package domain expertise and organizational workflows.

## API Integration

Skills are specified using the container parameter in the Messages API, and you can include up to 8 Skills per request.(no content)Skills integrate with the Messages API through the code execution tool, whether using pre-built Skills managed by Anthropic or custom Skills you've uploaded, with identical integration shape requiring code execution and using the same container structure.

## Key Features

- **Model-Invoked**: Skills are model-invoked—Claude autonomously decides when to use them based on your request and the Skill's description.
- **Custom Skills**: Create Skills as directories with SKILL.md files and Claude discovers and uses them automatically.
- **Beta Status**: Agent Skills (skills-2025-10-02 beta) is a new way to extend Claude's capabilities.

For detailed documentation, the official resources are available at the Claude API documentation pages and the Agent Skills cookbook for implementation examples.


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.

I've found comprehensive information about Claude Agent Skills. Here's what I discovered:

## What are Claude Agent Skills?

Claude Agent Skills are organized folders of instructions, scripts, and resources that agents can discover and load dynamically to perform better at specific tasks.(no content)Anthropic provides pre-built Agent Skills for common document tasks (PowerPoint, Excel, Word, PDF), and you can create your own custom Skills.

## How to Create Skills

### Basic Structure
Each Skill consists of a SKILL.md file with instructions that Claude reads when relevant, plus optional supporting files like scripts and templates.

### Three Ways to Create Skills
1. **Claude Code**: Create Skills as directories with SKILL.md files. Claude discovers and uses them automatically.

2. **Claude.ai**: The "skill-creator" skill provides interactive guidance: Claude asks about your workflow, generates the folder structure, formats the SKILL.md file, and bundles the resources you need.

3. **Claude API**: Create and upload your own Skills via the Skills API (/v1/skills endpoints).

## How to Define Skills

The Skill's YAML frontmatter provides discovery information with metadata like name and description. Claude loads this metadata at startup and includes it in the system prompt.

## How to Assign Skills

Skills are model-invoked—Claude autonomously decides when to use them based on your request and the Skill's description. Claude autonomously decides to use your Skill if it matches the request—you don't need to explicitly invoke it. The Skill activates automatically based on the context of your question.

### API Usage
You specify Skills using the container parameter in the Messages API.


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.

Links: [{"title":"Agent Skills - Claude Docs","url":"https://docs.claude.com/en/docs/agents-and-tools/agent-skills/overview"},{"title":"Building agents with the Claude Agent SDK \\ Anthropic","url":"https://www.anthropic.com/engineering/building-agents-with-the-claude-agent-sdk"},{"title":"Agent Skills - Claude Code Docs","url":"https://docs.claude.com/en/docs/claude-code/skills"},{"title":"Equipping agents for the real world with Agent Skills \\ Anthropic","url":"https://www.anthropic.com/engineering/equipping-agents-for-the-real-world-with-agent-skills"},{"title":"Introducing Agent Skills | Claude","url":"https://www.anthropic.com/news/skills"},{"title":"Claude Agent Skills: A First Principles Deep Dive","url":"https://leehanchung.github.io/blogs/2025/10/26/claude-skills-deep-dive/"},{"title":"Agent Skills in the SDK - Claude Docs","url":"https://platform.claude.com/docs/en/agent-sdk/skills"},{"title":"Agent SDK overview - Claude Docs","url":"https://platform.claude.com/docs/en/agent-sdk/overview"},{"title":"Skills explained: How Skills compares to prompts, Projects, MCP, and subagents | Claude","url":"https://www.claude.com/blog/skills-explained"},{"title":"Building Agents with Claude Code's SDK","url":"https://blog.promptlayer.com/building-agents-with-claude-codes-sdk/"}]

Based on the search results, here's a comprehensive overview of Agent Skills in the Claude SDK:

## What are Agent Skills?

Agent Skills are reusable, filesystem-based resources that provide Claude with domain-specific expertise: workflows, context, and best practices that transform general-purpose agents into specialists.(no content)Each Skill packages instructions, metadata, and optional resources (scripts, templates) that Claude uses automatically when relevant.

## Key Benefits

Unlike prompts (conversation-level instructions for one-off tasks), Skills load on-demand and eliminate the need to repeatedly provide the same guidance across multiple conversations.(no content)Skills are composable and stack together, with Claude automatically identifying which skills are needed and coordinating their use.

## Structure

Each Skill consists of a SKILL.md file with instructions that Claude reads when relevant, plus optional supporting files like scripts and templates.(no content)Skills are model-invoked—Claude autonomously decides when to use them based on your request and the Skill's description. This is different from slash commands, which are user-invoked.

## Best Practices for Development

Key guidelines for building effective Skills include:

1. Start with evaluation: Identify specific gaps in your agents' capabilities by running them on representative tasks and observing where they struggle or require additional context. Then build skills incrementally to address these shortcomings.

2. When the SKILL.md file becomes unwieldy, split its content into separate files and reference them. If certain contexts are mutually exclusive or rarely used together, keeping the paths separate will reduce the token usage.

3. Include both what the Skill does and when to use it in the description.

4. We strongly recommend using Skills only from trusted sources: those you created yourself or obtained from Anthropic. Skills provide Claude with new capabilities through instructions and code, and while this makes them powerful, it also means a malicious Skill can direct Claude to invoke tools or execute code in ways that don't match the Skill's stated purpose. If you must use a Skill from an untrusted or unknown source, exercise extreme caution and thoroughly audit it before use.

## Using Skills with the SDK

You must specify settingSources (TypeScript) or setting_sources (Python) to load Skills from the filesystem. Once filesystem settings are loaded, Skill metadata is discovered at startup from user and project directories; full content loaded when triggered.

For more detailed examples and implementation guides, you can check the official Claude documentation at docs.claude.com and the engineering blog for in-depth architectural information.


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.

content.text:
Based on the documentation, here's a comprehensive guide to Claude skills and how to assign them to agents:

## 1. What Claude Skills Are

Claude Agent Skills are organized, filesystem-based resources that extend agent capabilities with domain-specific expertise. Each Skill packages:
- Instructions (in a SKILL.md file)
- Metadata (name, description, discovery information)
- Optional supporting resources (scripts, templates, reference files)

Skills are **model-invoked**, meaning Claude autonomously decides when to use them based on your request and the Skill's description—you don't need to explicitly invoke them.

## 2. How to Create and Define Skills

### Basic Structure
Each Skill requires:
- A **SKILL.md file** with instructions that Claude reads when the Skill is relevant
- Optional supporting files (scripts, templates, reference documentation)

### Three Methods to Create Skills

1. **Claude Code**: Create Skills as directories with SKILL.md files in your `.claude/skills/` directory. Claude discovers and uses them automatically.

2. **Claude.ai**: Use the "skill-creator" skill which:
   - Asks about your workflow interactively
   - Generates folder structure
   - Formats the SKILL.md file
   - Bundles necessary resources

3. **Claude API**: Upload custom Skills via the Skills API (`/v1/skills` endpoints) using the Messages API with the `container` parameter.

### SKILL.md Format
The Skill's YAML frontmatter provides discovery metadata:
```yaml
---
name: "Skill Name"
description: "What this skill does and when to use it"
---

Your detailed instructions here...
```

## 3. How to Assign Skills to Agents

### In Claude Code
Once you create Skills as directories in your project's `.claude/skills/` directory, they're automatically discovered and available to agents.

### In the Claude Agent SDK
You must explicitly configure filesystem settings:

**TypeScript:**
```typescript
const agent = new Agent({
  settingSources: ['./skills']  // Specify where to load Skills from
});
```

**Python:**
```python
agent = Agent(
    setting_sources=['./skills']  # Specify where to load Skills from
)
```

### Via API
Specify Skills using the `container` parameter in the Messages API. You can include **up to 8 Skills per request**.

## 4. Examples of Using Skills with Agents

Skills activate automatically when relevant to the task. For example:
- If you ask an agent to work with PowerPoint files, it automatically uses the PowerPoint Skill
- If you create a "Data Analysis" Skill with instructions for handling datasets, the agent uses it when data analysis is needed
- Skills stack together—Claude coordinates multiple Skills when appropriate

## 5. Best Practices and Limitations

### Best Practices

1. **Start with evaluation**: Identify specific capability gaps by running agents on representative tasks, then build Skills incrementally to address shortcomings

2. **Include clear descriptions**: Your Skill description should state both WHAT it does and WHEN to use it—this helps Claude decide when to invoke it

3. **Split large Skills**: If your SKILL.md becomes unwieldy, split content into separate reference files and reference them from the main Skill

4. **Trust only known sources**: Skills provide Claude with new capabilities through instructions and code. Only use Skills from trusted sources (those you created or from Anthropic), as malicious Skills could direct Claude to invoke tools in unintended ways

5. **Reduce token usage**: Keep mutually exclusive or rarely-used-together contexts in separate Skill paths to minimize unnecessary token consumption

### Limitations

- Maximum **8 Skills per API request**
- Skills are discovered at startup from filesystem; metadata is loaded eagerly, full content loaded when triggered
- Skill security depends on trusting the source—thoroughly audit Skills from unknown sources before use

---

Sources:
- [Agent Skills Overview - Claude Docs](https://docs.claude.com/en/docs/agents-and-tools/agent-skills/overview)
- [Agent Skills Quickstart - Claude Docs](https://platform.claude.com/docs/en/agents-and-tools/agent-skills/quickstart)
- [Agent Skills in the SDK - Claude Docs](https://platform.claude.com/docs/en/agent-sdk/skills)
- [Equipping Agents with Agent Skills - Anthropic](https://www.anthropic.com/engineering/equipping-agents-for-the-real-world-with-agent-skills)
- [Skills Explained - Claude Blog](https://www.claude.com/blog/skills-explained)
- [Claude Agent Skills Deep Dive](https://leehanchung.github.io/blogs/2025/10/26/claude-skills-deep-dive/)
